subject: Photography
title: Color and Cultural Meaning
description: One-minute skill: Color and Cultural Meaning.

hook.text: White means purity in the West and mourning in parts of Asia. Color meaning isn't universal.

buildup.text: Cultural associations shape how viewers interpret color in photographs. Context matters as much as hue.

discovery.text: Purple is royal in Europe because the dye was rare. Orange is sacred in Hinduism. Every color has local meaning.

twist.text: Global media is slowly homogenizing color meanings, but regional differences still surprise foreign photographers.

climax.text: Photographers working across cultures must research local color symbolism to avoid unintended messages.

punchline.text: Same color, different culture, different meaning entirely.

quiz.question: Why must photographers understand cultural color symbolism?
options: The same color can convey completely different meanings in different cultures
Colors always mean the same thing globally
It's only important for fashion photography
